dominante_domeinen.conceptuele_metafoor: FAITH IS A BUILDING / TRADITION IS A FOUNDATION

kernfrasen: drift back into forms of religious legalism

mapping_structuur.doel_element: Loss of faith in the congregation

cognitieve_implicaties: The hearer feels under siege and vulnerable.
theologische_implicaties: Doctrine is a protective wall that must be defended.
ethische_implicaties: The believer must stand firm and resist change.
onbedoelde_consequenties: Scholars are viewed as enemies rather than seekers.

metafoor_inventaris.vitaliteit_toelichting: The preacher re-activates the military metaphor by applying it to modern 'media-skilled' scholars.

metafoor_inventaris.metafoor_expressie: Jesus as a literary presence... like Ebenezer Scrooge.

doeldomein.doctrinale_traditie: Liberal Theology (as critiqued by the preacher)

mapping_structuur.doel_element: Jesus in the mind of the skeptic

cognitieve_implicaties: Jesus is confined to the pages of history/text.
theologische_implicaties: Denial of the Resurrection and current agency of Christ.
ethische_implicaties: Faith becomes an aesthetic appreciation rather than obedience.
onbedoelde_consequenties: Reduces the Bible to mere literature.

metafoor_inventaris.vitaliteit_toelichting: The preacher uses this as a 'foil' metaphor to disrupt the hearer's potential skepticism.

coherentie_analyse.coherentie_verklaring: The sermon maintains a consistent tension between 'Stability/Foundation' and 'Assault/Erosion'. It successfully links the physical 'shame' of the Cross with the intellectual 'shame' of modern skepticism.

succesvolle_blending.blending_strategie: Blends the Relational (Fatherly protection) with the Journey (navigation through darkness) to provide comfort.

sterktes.beschrijving: Re-activates the 'shame' of the cross by comparing it to the intellectual embarrassment felt in modern academic circles.
sterktes.voorbeeld: fearing to seem outmoded, outclassed, lacking in intellectual or moral courage.

risicos.beschrijving: The military language ('insidious', 'assaults') creates an 'us vs. them' mentality against the academy.
risicos.voorbeeld: A number of scholars... steadily building a case against the Church.
risicos.potentiele_impact: Congregation may become hostile toward intellectual inquiry.

text_world_analyse.primaire_wereld: A besieged fortress (The Church) under attack by modern iconoclasts.
sub_worlds: The first-century Roman/Corinthian world of Paul
The hospital room of a suicidal son

deictic_shifts.effectiviteit: Extremely effective; it moves the metaphor from the head to the gut.

versterkte_schemas.hoe_versterkt: By emphasizing the 'right hand of God' and the cosmic scale of Romans 8.

verstoorde_schemas.verstoring_strategie: Contrasting the 'Sage of Nazareth' with the 'Crucified Lord'.

schema_analyse.liturgische_schema_aansluiting: Fits the Lenten theme of the Cross and the 'Way of Sorrows'.

aanbevelingen.metafoor_audit_samenvatting: The sermon is dominated by Conflict and Architectural metaphors. It frames the current theological climate as a battlefield where the 'foundation' of the church is being 'eroded' by 'insidious' forces. This creates a strong sense of urgency and identity for the hearer.

revitalisatie_suggesties.voorbeeld: The shame of being the only one in the room who believes in the Resurrection.

coherentie_verbeteringen.incoherentie: The transition from 'Military' (fighting scholars) to 'Medical' (the suicidal son).
coherentie_verbeteringen.resolutie_strategie: Use the 'Cross' as the bridge—the Cross is both the weapon against pride and the place of healing for the broken.

entailment_checks.problematisch_entailment: If Jesus is only in the text, he cannot act in the present.
entailment_checks.aanbeveling: Emphasize the 'Living Word' (Hebrews 4:12) to bridge text and presence.

alternatieve_domeinen.rationale: To strengthen the 'Intercessor' concept in Romans 8.
alternatieve_domeinen.doel_concept: Jesus at the right hand of God

aanbevelingen.slotopmerking: A masterclass in using CMT to expose the cognitive poverty of 'Jesus as a literary figure' while providing a robust, embodied alternative.

comparatieve_analyse.verschil_met_esthetiek: An aesthetic analysis would praise the 'ringing words' of Paul; CMT reveals how those words function as a cognitive shield.
comparatieve_analyse.verschil_met_kolb: Kolb would focus on the 'experience' of the suicidal son; CMT focuses on how the 'Love of God' is mapped as a physical bond that cannot be 'separated'.
comparatieve_analyse.unieke_inzichten_CMT: CMT identifies that 'shame' is a social-spatial metaphor (hiding/turning away) which the preacher successfully flips into a theological stance.

appendices.notities: The preacher uses the 'Scrooge' analogy to make the abstract concept of 'literary presence' concrete and then dismiss it.
